result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven L. Leider was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery by Prisoners, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Steven L. Leider in court with attorney Andrew M. Morgan.  Defendant Steven L. Leider in custody.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called 14CF74, 15CT34, 15CF176 and 11CF192.  Called at 3:17 pm.  Plea agreement  14CF74 plea to Ct 1 & 6.  15CF176 plea to count. WIthdraw NGI.  Upon pleas being entered. state moves to dismiss and read in 15CT34 and balance of counts in 14CF74, Ct 2,3,4 & 5.  Plea questionnaire filed and reviewed.  Def will plea no contest to Ct 1 & 6 in 14CF74 and 15CF176.  Constitutional rights, charges and penalties  reviewed.  Elements reviewed. Court finds pleas entered freely & voluntarily.  Other counts dimissed and read in.  Def acknowledges previous felony conviction.  State gives sentence recommendations.  Court finds def understands charges, penalties and rights.  Plea accecpt and found guilty.  Sentencing arguments by State.  11CF192 Credit of 419 days and 14CF74 4 days credit if revoked.  Atty Morgan presents sentencing arguments.  Statement by def.  11CF192 Ct 5, Court orders 6 yr prison 2 yrs intitial conf and 4 yrs extended supervison.  Concurrent with present term.  Follow all recommendation of probation  Credit 419 days.  15CF176 Ct 1 - Sentence 6 months incarceration  Consecutive to prison term.  DNA surcharge and sample  14CF74 Ct 1 - Sentence withheld 2 yrs probation.  Follow rules of probation.    Ct 6 - Sentence withheld 3 yrs probation  Follow standard rules of probation.  Cost on both.  11CF192 Def is eligible for challenge inc.   Felony convictions reviewed.  14CF74 credit of 4 days if revoked.  Post convictions rights.  Statement by Atty Morgan.  Response by State.   Def is also eligilbe for substance abuse program  11CF192 - cost to be paid    If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Defendant Steven L. Leider in court with attorney Andrew M. Morgan.  Defendant Steven L. Leider in custody.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Judge Rhode also present.  14CF74, 15CT34 Judge Kuessell cases, 11CF192 and 15CF176 Judge Rhode's cases.  Off record discussion.  Counsel and def agree to Judge Kussell hearing all cases. Matter to be adjourned until later to see if parties can reached an agreement.  Bond will continue
Ad Prosequendum and Order to Institution (filed in 11-CF-192)
Ad Prosequendum and Order to Institution (filed in 11-CF-192)

Defendant Steven L. Leider in court with attorney Andrew M. Morgan.  Defendant Steven L. Leider in custody.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called @ 1:43 p.m. Discussion prior to going on the record regarding proceeding under this Court. The Court will withdraw if either party feels appropriate. Both State and Atty Morgan willing to proceed with this Court. Def also willing to proceed. Revocation packet has been received. Atty Morgan would like to adjourn this hearing while working out agreement on all cases. Discussion regarding possibility of adjourning and issue of some cases assigned to Judge Kussel. Court will allow adjournment of sentencing after revocation on 11CF192. Off the record for scheduling @ 1:52 p.m. Back on the record 1:55. 5/4/16 @ 1:00 p.m. for 11CF192 sentencing after revocation and 15CF176 plea/sentencing or status. 14CF74 and 15CT34 status conf. or plea/sentencing - 5/4/16 @ 1:00 p.m. with Judge Kussel, subject to his approval.  JA will send notices.

Defendant Steven L. Leider in court via video with attorney Andrew M. Morgan.  Defendant Steven L. Leider in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called @ 3:06 p.m. State has received copy of Dr's report and agree. Atty Morgan has received copy of report, wishes to have second opinion. Court will allow, however, needs to be at P.D.'s expense. Atty Morgan will look into this, or possibility of insurance coverage. Advises of status of incarceration on other matters. Will schedule for status conference.  Status conference scheduled for December 28, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Steven L. Leider in court with attorney Andrew M. Morgan.  Defendant Steven L. Leider in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Called at 3:16 pm.  Def wishes to waive preliminary.  Waiver of preliminary form filed and reviewed by court.  Def waives right to preliminary.  Court will accept waiver.  Information filed.  Discussion of new judge being appointed.  Not requested by counsel or def.  Ready to proceed to arraignment.  Statement by Atty Morgan.  Not guilty plea and not guilty by mental disease.  Court directs clerk  enter both pleas.  Court will order an examine.  JA will prepare order and set this mater.  Bond will continue  Atty Morgan request cash bond,  statement by court, motion denied.

Defendant Steven L. Leider in court via video with attorney Andrew M. Morgan.  Defendant Steven L. Leider in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint received.  Waive reading of complaint.  Def is on probation hold  Time limits for preliminary waived.  Preliminary hearing will also be waived.  Court explains right to preliminary hearing.  Bond will continue  Waiver of Prelim scheduled for October 26, 2015 at 03:15 pm.

Defendant Steven L. Leider in court via video.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Def does not have a copy of complaint.  Court reviews charge with possible penalties.  Copy of complaint will go over with bond.  Def is on probation hold.  State request signature bond.  Bond set by Court.   Right to atty reviewed.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
